sections.content: Melbourne is one step closer to having a new mRNA vaccine manufacturing facility, after [Multiplex](https://www.multiplex.global/au/) was awarded the construction contract by Moderna.

The facility will be located within the [Monash Technology Precinct](https://www.monash.edu/industry/monash-technology-precinct), and will be the first of its kind in the southern hemisphere. It's being established under a 10-year partnership between Moderna, and the Victorian and Australian governments.

Designed by Greenbox, CRB and IPS, the facility will house pharmaceutical-grade space – including Drug Substance (DS) and Drug Product (DP) areas – within its 16,500 square metres. Additional features include laboratories, a warehouse with loading dock, and extensive outdoor landscaping.

Moderna's new facility will be able to produce COVID vaccines – as well as mRNA vaccines for a variety of other respiratory illnesses. Importantly, it will supply Australia with its own onshore mRNA manufacturing capability in the event of a new pandemic.
Construction is due to be completed in 2024.
